revised_title: Observations on Salt-Marsh Muscle, Oyster-Banks, and Fresh-Water Muscle in Pennsylvania
tldr: Dr. John Bartram describes his observations of the Salt-Marsh Muscle, Oyster-Banks, and Fresh-Water Muscle in Pennsylvania. He discusses the unique ways these creatures obtain nourishment and how they are adapted to their environments. He also compares the growth patterns of oysters to that of the Opuntia, or Indian Fig plant.
